original_definition: 'physical congestion' means a situation where the level of demand for actual deliveries exceeds the technical capacity at some point in time;
generated_definition: 'physical congestion' means in the event that physical congestion exists, non-discriminatory, transparent capacity-allocation mechanisms shall be applied by the transmission system operator or, as appropriate, by the regulatory authorities.

Article\u00a016: 4.   In the event thatphysical congestionexists, non-discriminatory, transparentcapacity-allocation mechanisms shall be applied by thetransmission system operator or, as appropriate, by the regulatory authorities.

4.   In the event that physical congestion exists, non-discriminatory, transparent capacity-allocation mechanisms shall be applied by the transmission system operator or, as appropriate, by the regulatory authorities.
Article\u00a032: all essential points within the network of a given transmission system operator including points connecting to gas hubs. All points are considered essential which, based on experience, are likely to experience physical congestion;

all essential points within the network of a giventransmissionsystem operator including points connecting to gas hubs. All points are considered essential which, based on experience, are likely to experiencephysical congestion;
Not Article: Althoughphysical congestionof networks is, at present, rarely a problem in the Community, it may become one in the future. It is important, therefore, to provide the basic principle for the allocation of congestedcapacity in such circumstances.

Although physical congestion of networks is, at present, rarely a problem in the Community, it may become one in the future. It is important, therefore, to provide the basic principle for the allocation of congested capacity in such circumstances.
